Appendix A Auxiliary functions for NMF

We give a brief overview of the fundamental idea of majorization-minimization algorithms and the construction of auxiliary functions for NMF with the KL divergence. This section is based on [43, 28, 17].

Consider the optimization problem

minY‚ààùí¥‚Å°F‚Å¢(Y)subscriptùëåùí¥ùêπùëå\min_{Y\in\mathcal{Y}}F(Y)roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Y ‚àà caligraphic_Y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F ( italic_Y )

for ùí¥‚äÜ‚ÑùMùí¥superscript‚ÑùùëÄ\mathcal{Y}\subseteq\mathbb{R}^{M}caligraphic_Y ‚äÜ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_M end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and a function F:ùí¥‚Üí‚Ñù.:ùêπ‚Üíùí¥‚ÑùF\colon\mathcal{Y}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}.italic_F : caligraphic_Y ‚Üí blackboard_R . Within the context of the majorization-minimization framework, the strategy to minimize FùêπFitalic_F consists of two-steps. First, an auxiliary function G:ùí¥√óùí¥‚Üí‚Ñù:ùê∫‚Üíùí¥ùí¥‚ÑùG\colon\mathcal{Y}\times\mathcal{Y}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}italic_G : caligraphic_Y √ó caligraphic_Y ‚Üí blackboard_R with

G‚Å¢(Y,Y‚Ä≤)‚â•F‚Å¢(Y),ùê∫ùëåsuperscriptùëå‚Ä≤ùêπùëå\displaystyle G(Y,Y^{\prime})\geq F(Y),italic_G ( italic_Y , italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚â• italic_F ( italic_Y ) ,
G‚Å¢(Y‚Ä≤,Y‚Ä≤)=F‚Å¢(Y‚Ä≤)ùê∫superscriptùëå‚Ä≤superscriptùëå‚Ä≤ùêπsuperscriptùëå‚Ä≤\displaystyle G(Y^{\prime},Y^{\prime})=F(Y^{\prime})italic_G ( italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_F ( italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT )

for all Y,Y‚Ä≤‚ààùí¥ùëåsuperscriptùëå‚Ä≤ùí¥Y,Y^{\prime}\in\mathcal{Y}italic_Y , italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà caligraphic_Y is constructed. The majorizer Gùê∫Gitalic_G of FùêπFitalic_F is then minimized in every iteration, that is,

Y(n+1)=argminY‚ààùí¥G‚Å¢(Y,Y(n)).superscriptùëåùëõ1subscriptargminùëåùí¥ùê∫ùëåsuperscriptùëåùëõY^{(n+1)}=\operatorname*{argmin}_{Y\in\mathcal{Y}}G(Y,Y^{(n)}).italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = roman_argmin start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Y ‚àà caligraphic_Y end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G ( italic_Y , italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

Indeed, this procedure yields a non-increasing objective function value due to

F‚Å¢(Y(n+1))‚â§G‚Å¢(Y(n+1),Y(n))‚â§G‚Å¢(Y(n),Y(n))=F‚Å¢(Y(n)).ùêπsuperscriptùëåùëõ1ùê∫superscriptùëåùëõ1superscriptùëåùëõùê∫superscriptùëåùëõsuperscriptùëåùëõùêπsuperscriptùëåùëõF(Y^{(n+1)})\leq G(Y^{(n+1)},Y^{(n)})\leq G(Y^{(n)},Y^{(n)})=F(Y^{(n)}).italic_F ( italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚â§ italic_G ( italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚â§ italic_G ( italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_F ( italic_Y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) .

In the case of NMF with the KL divergence, the goal is to decompose X‚àà‚Ñù+V√óDùëãsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñùùëâùê∑X\in\mathbb{R}_{+}^{V\times D}italic_X ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT into the product of two non-negative matrices W‚àà‚Ñù+V√óKùëäsuperscriptsubscript‚ÑùùëâùêæW\in\mathbb{R}_{+}^{V\times K}italic_W ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and H‚àà‚Ñù+K√óDùêªsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñùùêæùê∑H\in\mathbb{R}_{+}^{K\times D}italic_H ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT by minimizing the reconstruction error

DKL(X||WH)=‚àëv,dxv‚Å¢dlogxv‚Å¢d(W‚Å¢H)v‚Å¢d‚àíxv‚Å¢d+(WH)v‚Å¢d.D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,WH)=\sum_{v,d}x_{vd}\log\frac{x_{vd}}{(WH)_{vd}}-x_{vd}+(% WH)_{vd}.italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Note that it is equivalent to minimize

F(W,H)=‚àí‚àëv,dxv‚Å¢dlog(WH)v‚Å¢d+(WH)v‚Å¢d.F(W,H)=-\sum_{v,d}x_{vd}\log(WH)_{vd}+(WH)_{vd}.italic_F ( italic_W , italic_H ) = - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

For simplicity, we will therefore often refer to DKLsubscriptùê∑KLD_{\text{KL}}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and FùêπFitalic_F interchangeably. An auxiliary function of DKLsubscriptùê∑KLD_{\text{KL}}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT can now be constructed using the following two well-known results.

Lemma A.1 ([28, Lemma 3]).

Consider the function F(W,H)=‚àílog(WH)v‚Å¢dF(W,H)=-\log(WH)_{vd}italic_F ( italic_W , italic_H ) = - roman_log ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for two indices v,dùë£ùëëv,ditalic_v , italic_d. Then the function Gùê∫Gitalic_G defined by

œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤subscriptsuperscriptitalic-œï‚Ä≤ùë£ùëòùëë\displaystyle\phi^{\prime}_{vkd}italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âîwv‚Å¢k‚Ä≤‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d‚Ä≤(W‚Ä≤‚Å¢H‚Ä≤)v‚Å¢d,‚âîabsentsubscriptsuperscriptùë§‚Ä≤ùë£ùëòsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñé‚Ä≤ùëòùëësubscriptsuperscriptùëä‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤ùë£ùëë\displaystyle\coloneqq\frac{w^{\prime}_{vk}h^{\prime}_{kd}}{(W^{\prime}H^{% \prime})_{vd}},‚âî divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ,
G‚Å¢((W,H),(W‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤))ùê∫ùëäùêªsuperscriptùëä‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤\displaystyle G((W,H),(W^{\prime},H^{\prime}))italic_G ( ( italic_W , italic_H ) , ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) =‚àí‚àëkœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤‚Å¢log‚Å°wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤absentsubscriptùëòsubscriptsuperscriptitalic-œï‚Ä≤ùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptsuperscriptitalic-œï‚Ä≤ùë£ùëòùëë\displaystyle=-\sum_{k}\phi^{\prime}_{vkd}\log\frac{w_{vk}h_{kd}}{\phi^{\prime% }_{vkd}}= - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG

is an auxiliary function of F.ùêπF.italic_F .

Proof.

The equality G‚Å¢((W‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤),(W‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤))=F‚Å¢(W‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤)ùê∫superscriptùëä‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤superscriptùëä‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤ùêπsuperscriptùëä‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤G((W^{\prime},H^{\prime}),(W^{\prime},H^{\prime}))=F(W^{\prime},H^{\prime})italic_G ( ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) , ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) = italic_F ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is easy to verify and Jensen‚Äôs inequality implies

log(WH)v‚Å¢d=log‚àëkœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤‚â•‚àëkœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤logwv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤.\log(WH)_{vd}=\log\sum_{k}\phi^{\prime}_{vkd}\frac{w_{vk}h_{kd}}{\phi^{\prime}% _{vkd}}\geq\sum_{k}\phi^{\prime}_{vkd}\log\frac{w_{vk}h_{kd}}{\phi^{\prime}_{% vkd}}.roman_log ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_log ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚â• ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .

‚àé

Lemma A.2.

Consider finitely many function Fi:ùí¥‚Üí‚Ñù:subscriptùêπùëñ‚Üíùí¥‚ÑùF_{i}\colon\mathcal{Y}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT : caligraphic_Y ‚Üí blackboard_R with auxiliary functions Gi,subscriptùê∫ùëñG_{i},italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , and let ci‚àà‚Ñù+subscriptùëêùëñsubscript‚Ñùc_{i}\in\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then G=‚àëici‚Å¢Giùê∫subscriptùëñsubscriptùëêùëñsubscriptùê∫ùëñG=\sum_{i}c_{i}G_{i}italic_G = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is an auxiliary function of F=‚àëici‚Å¢Fi.ùêπsubscriptùëñsubscriptùëêùëñsubscriptùêπùëñF=\sum_{i}c_{i}F_{i}.italic_F = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Proof.

Follows from the definition of auxiliary functions. ‚àé

Corollary A.3 ([28, Lemma 3]).

Consider the function

F(W,H)=‚àí‚àëv,dxv‚Å¢dlog(WH)v‚Å¢d+(WH)v‚Å¢d.F(W,H)=-\sum_{v,d}x_{vd}\log(WH)_{vd}+(WH)_{vd}.italic_F ( italic_W , italic_H ) = - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Then the function Gùê∫Gitalic_G defined by

œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤subscriptsuperscriptitalic-œï‚Ä≤ùë£ùëòùëë\displaystyle\phi^{\prime}_{vkd}italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =wv‚Å¢k‚Ä≤‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d‚Ä≤(W‚Ä≤‚Å¢H‚Ä≤)v‚Å¢d,absentsubscriptsuperscriptùë§‚Ä≤ùë£ùëòsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñé‚Ä≤ùëòùëësubscriptsuperscriptùëä‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤ùë£ùëë\displaystyle=\frac{w^{\prime}_{vk}h^{\prime}_{kd}}{(W^{\prime}H^{\prime})_{vd% }},= divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ,
G‚Å¢((W,H),(W‚Ä≤,H‚Ä≤))ùê∫ùëäùêªsuperscriptùëä‚Ä≤superscriptùêª‚Ä≤\displaystyle G((W,H),(W^{\prime},H^{\prime}))italic_G ( ( italic_W , italic_H ) , ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) =‚àí‚àëv,k,dxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤‚Å¢log‚Å°wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Ä≤+‚àëv,d(W‚Å¢H)v‚Å¢dabsentsubscriptùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptsuperscriptitalic-œï‚Ä≤ùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptsuperscriptitalic-œï‚Ä≤ùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë£ùëësubscriptùëäùêªùë£ùëë\displaystyle=-\sum_{v,k,d}x_{vd}\phi^{\prime}_{vkd}\log\frac{w_{vk}h_{kd}}{% \phi^{\prime}_{vkd}}+\sum_{v,d}(WH)_{vd}= - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

is an auxiliary function of FùêπFitalic_F.

Proof.

Apply Lemma¬†A.1 and Lemma¬†A.2. ‚àé

Appendix B NMF with normalization constraints

In this section, we first proof 4.2, which states that global optima of NMF with a normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W (18) and NMF with a normalization constraint on both WùëäWitalic_W and HùêªHitalic_H (19) are identical up to a scaling of their topic weights by the total word counts ‚àëvxv‚Å¢dsubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëë\sum_{v}x_{vd}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Second, we provide details to the derivation of the joint update rules of the two NMF problems with normalization constraints. Lastly, we show that the connection from 4.2 extends to iterates and fixed points of their MU algorithms.

Lemma 4.2.

Let (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of NMF with a normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W (18) and let Œªd=‚àëvxv‚Å¢dsubscriptùúÜùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëë\lambda_{d}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then (W,H~)ùëä~ùêª(W,\widetilde{H})( italic_W , over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) with h~k‚Å¢d=hk‚Å¢d/Œªdsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëësubscript‚ÑéùëòùëësubscriptùúÜùëë\widetilde{h}_{kd}=h_{kd}/\lambda_{d}over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a solution of NMF with a normalization constraint on both WùëäWitalic_W and HùêªHitalic_H (19). Conversely, let (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of (19). Then (W,H~)ùëä~ùêª(W,\widetilde{H})( italic_W , over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) with h~k‚Å¢d=Œªd‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dsubscript~‚ÑéùëòùëësubscriptùúÜùëësubscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\widetilde{h}_{kd}=\lambda_{d}h_{kd}over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a solution of (18).

Proof.

The main ingredient of the proof is that solutions of NMF with the KL divergence (2) preserve the column sums of XùëãXitalic_X. That is, for any solution (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) of (2), we have

‚àëv(W‚Å¢H)v‚Å¢d=‚àëvxv‚Å¢dsubscriptùë£subscriptùëäùêªùë£ùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëë\sum_{v}(WH)_{vd}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (26)

[17, Theorem 6.9]. Now, let (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of NMF with an additional normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W. Due to Lemma¬†4.1, it is also a solution of the standard NMF problem (2). From (26) and wk‚ààŒîV‚àí1subscriptùë§ùëòsubscriptŒîùëâ1w_{k}\in\Delta_{V-1}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it follows that ‚àëkhk‚Å¢d=‚àëvxv‚Å¢d=Œªd.subscriptùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptùúÜùëë\sum_{k}h_{kd}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}=\lambda_{d}.‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . Hence, the candidate solution (W,H~)ùëä~ùêª(W,\widetilde{H})( italic_W , over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) defined via h~k‚Å¢d=hk‚Å¢d/Œªdsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëësubscript‚ÑéùëòùëësubscriptùúÜùëë\widetilde{h}_{kd}=h_{kd}/\lambda_{d}over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT / italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT indeed fulfills the additional normalization constraint, and we also have

DKL(X||WH)=‚àëv,dxv‚Å¢dlogxv‚Å¢d(W‚Å¢H)v‚Å¢d.D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,WH)=\sum_{v,d}x_{vd}\log\frac{x_{vd}}{(WH)_{vd}}.italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_W italic_H ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG .

The result can now be shown using a standard proof by contraction. ‚àé

In the following, we provide details to the constrained joint optimization of the joint auxiliary function Gùê∫Gitalic_G of DKL(X||WH)D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,WH)italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ). Recall from (7) that Gùê∫Gitalic_G is given by

œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)superscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõ\displaystyle\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =wv‚Å¢k(n)‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d(n)(W(n)‚Å¢H(n))v‚Å¢d,absentsuperscriptsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòùëõsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëëùëõsubscriptsuperscriptùëäùëõsuperscriptùêªùëõùë£ùëë\displaystyle=\frac{w_{vk}^{(n)}h_{kd}^{(n)}}{(W^{(n)}H^{(n)})_{vd}},= divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ,
G‚Å¢((W,H),(W(n),H(n)))ùê∫ùëäùêªsuperscriptùëäùëõsuperscriptùêªùëõ\displaystyle G((W,H),(W^{(n)},H^{(n)}))italic_G ( ( italic_W , italic_H ) , ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) =‚àí‚àëv,k,dxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)‚Å¢log‚Å°wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)+wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d,absentsubscriptùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle=-\sum_{v,k,d}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}\log\frac{w_{vk}h_{kd}}{\phi_% {vkd}^{(n)}}+w_{vk}h_{kd},= - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

so the derivatives of Gùê∫Gitalic_G are

‚àÇwv‚Å¢kG‚Å¢((W,H),(W(n),H(n)))subscriptsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòùê∫ùëäùêªsuperscriptùëäùëõsuperscriptùêªùëõ\displaystyle\partial_{w_{vk}}G((W,H),(W^{(n)},H^{(n)}))‚àÇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G ( ( italic_W , italic_H ) , ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) =‚àí1wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢‚àëdxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)+‚àëdhk‚Å¢d,absent1subscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscriptùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõsubscriptùëësubscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle=-\frac{1}{w_{vk}}\sum_{d}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}+\sum_{d}h_{kd},= - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,
‚àÇhk‚Å¢dG‚Å¢((W,H),(W(n),H(n)))subscriptsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëëùê∫ùëäùêªsuperscriptùëäùëõsuperscriptùêªùëõ\displaystyle\partial_{h_{kd}}G((W,H),(W^{(n)},H^{(n)}))‚àÇ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_G ( ( italic_W , italic_H ) , ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) =‚àí1hk‚Å¢d‚Å¢‚àëvxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)+‚àëvwv‚Å¢k.absent1subscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõsubscriptùë£subscriptùë§ùë£ùëò\displaystyle=-\frac{1}{h_{kd}}\sum_{v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}+\sum_{v}w_{vk}.= - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

With the additional normalization constraints wk‚ààŒîV‚àí1subscriptùë§ùëòsubscriptŒîùëâ1w_{k}\in\Delta_{V-1}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the method of Lagrange multipliers implies that there exist Œªk‚àà‚ÑùsubscriptùúÜùëò‚Ñù\lambda_{k}\in\mathbb{R}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R with

1wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢‚àëdxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)‚àí‚àëdhk‚Å¢d=Œªk,1subscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscriptùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõsubscriptùëësubscript‚ÑéùëòùëësubscriptùúÜùëò\frac{1}{w_{vk}}\sum_{d}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}-\sum_{d}h_{kd}=\lambda_{k},divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

which yields

wv‚Å¢k‚àù‚àëdxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n).proportional-tosubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscriptùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõw_{vk}\propto\sum_{d}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}.italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àù ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (27)

Setting the derivative of Gùê∫Gitalic_G with respect to hk‚Å¢dsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëëh_{kd}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT equal to zero and again utilizing wk‚ààŒîV‚àí1subscriptùë§ùëòsubscriptŒîùëâ1w_{k}\in\Delta_{V-1}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we immediately obtain

hk‚Å¢d=‚àëvxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n).subscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõh_{kd}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (28)

If we additionally require the columns of HùêªHitalic_H to be normalized, i.e., hd‚ààŒîK‚àí1subscript‚ÑéùëësubscriptŒîùêæ1h_{d}\in\Delta_{K-1}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the method of Lagrange multipliers implies that there exist Œªd‚àà‚ÑùsubscriptùúÜùëë‚Ñù\lambda_{d}\in\mathbb{R}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R with

1hk‚Å¢d‚Å¢‚àëvxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)‚àí1=Œªd,1subscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõ1subscriptùúÜùëë\frac{1}{h_{kd}}\sum_{v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}-1=\lambda_{d},divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

which yields

hk‚Å¢d‚àù‚àëvxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n).proportional-tosubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõh_{kd}\propto\sum_{v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}.italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àù ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (29)

Notice that the normalization in (29) just scales (28) by the total word counts ‚àëvxv‚Å¢dsubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëë\sum_{v}x_{vd}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. More precisely, denoting the nùëõnitalic_n-th iterate of the NMF with a normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W Algorithm¬†4 by (W(n),NMF,H(n),NMF)superscriptùëäùëõNMFsuperscriptùêªùëõNMF(W^{(n),\text{NMF}},H^{(n),\text{NMF}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) and the nùëõnitalic_n-th iterate of NMF with a normalization constraint on both WùëäWitalic_W and HùêªHitalic_H / PLSA Algorithm¬†6 by (W(n),PLSA,H(n),PLSA)superscriptùëäùëõPLSAsuperscriptùêªùëõPLSA(W^{(n),\text{PLSA}},H^{(n),\text{PLSA}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), we obtain the following result.

Lemma B.1.

Let X‚àà‚Ñù+V√óDùëãsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùê∑X\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}italic_X ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and let Œªd=‚àëvxv‚Å¢dsubscriptùúÜùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëë\lambda_{d}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let W(0)‚ààŒîV‚àí1K,H(0)‚ààŒîK‚àí1Dformulae-sequencesuperscriptùëä0superscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæsuperscriptùêª0superscriptsubscriptŒîùêæ1ùê∑W^{(0)}\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K},\,H^{(0)}\in\Delta_{K-1}^{D}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be normalized initial values. Then for all n‚â•1ùëõ1n\geq 1italic_n ‚â• 1

W(n),NMFsuperscriptùëäùëõNMF\displaystyle W^{(n),\text{NMF}}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =W(n),PLSA,absentsuperscriptùëäùëõPLSA\displaystyle=W^{(n),\text{PLSA}},= italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,
hk‚Å¢d(n),NMFsuperscriptsubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëùëõNMF\displaystyle h_{kd}^{(n),\text{NMF}}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =Œªd‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d(n),PLSA,absentsubscriptùúÜùëësuperscriptsubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëùëõPLSA\displaystyle=\lambda_{d}h_{kd}^{(n),\text{PLSA}},= italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,
‚àëkhk‚Å¢d(n),NMFsubscriptùëòsuperscriptsubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëùëõNMF\displaystyle\sum_{k}h_{kd}^{(n),\text{NMF}}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =Œªd.absentsubscriptùúÜùëë\displaystyle=\lambda_{d}.= italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .
Proof.

Using ‚àëk,vxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)=‚àëvxv‚Å¢d=Œªdsubscriptùëòùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõsubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptùúÜùëë\sum_{k,v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}=\lambda_{d}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, the statement follows by induction. ‚àé

Corollary B.2.

Let X‚àà‚Ñù+V√óDùëãsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùê∑X\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}italic_X ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and let Œªd=‚àëvxv‚Å¢dsubscriptùúÜùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëë\lambda_{d}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let (W‚àó,NMF,H‚àó,NMF)superscriptùëäNMFsuperscriptùêªNMF(W^{*,\text{NMF}},H^{*,\text{NMF}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) be a fixed point of NMF with a normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W Algorithm¬†4. Then (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) with W=W‚àó,NMFùëäsuperscriptùëäNMFW=W^{*,\text{NMF}}italic_W = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hk‚Å¢d=hk‚Å¢d‚àó,NMF/Œªdsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësuperscriptsubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëNMFsubscriptùúÜùëëh_{kd}=h_{kd}^{*,\text{NMF}}/\lambda_{d}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is a fixed point of NMF with a normalization constraint on both WùëäWitalic_W and HùêªHitalic_H / PLSA Algorithm¬†6. Conversely, let (W‚àó,PLSA,H‚àó,PLSA)superscriptùëäPLSAsuperscriptùêªPLSA(W^{*,\text{PLSA}},H^{*,\text{PLSA}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) be a fixed point of Algorithm¬†6. Then (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) with W=W‚àó,PLSAùëäsuperscriptùëäPLSAW=W^{*,\text{PLSA}}italic_W = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and hk‚Å¢d=Œªd‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d‚àó,PLSAsubscript‚ÑéùëòùëësubscriptùúÜùëësuperscriptsubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëPLSAh_{kd}=\lambda_{d}h_{kd}^{*,\text{PLSA}}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , PLSA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is a fixed point of Algorithm¬†4.

Proof.

Follows directly from Lemma¬†B.1 and ‚àëkhk‚Å¢d‚àó,NMF=‚àëvxv‚Å¢d=Œªdsubscriptùëòsuperscriptsubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëNMFsubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptùúÜùëë\sum_{k}h_{kd}^{*,\text{NMF}}=\sum_{v}x_{vd}=\lambda_{d}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó , NMF end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for any fixed point of Algorithm¬†4. ‚àé

Appendix C Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson model

In this section, we derive the variational lower bound of the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson model with a normalized topic matrix W‚ààŒîV‚àí1KùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT described in Section¬†5. Recall the generative process of the word counts of a single document dùëëditalic_d:

  1. 1.

    Sample the topic proportions hd‚àºDir‚Å°(Œ±)similar-tosubscript‚ÑéùëëDirùõºh_{d}\sim\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Dir ( italic_Œ± ).

  2. 2.

    Sample the topic contributions zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚àºPoisson‚Å°(wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d)similar-tosubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëPoissonsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëëz_{vkd}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}(w_{vk}h_{kd})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Poisson ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  3. 3.

    Xv‚Å¢d=‚àëkzv‚Å¢k‚Å¢dsubscriptùëãùë£ùëësubscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëX_{vd}=\sum_{k}z_{vkd}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Under this model, the joint likelihood of the observed counts xdsubscriptùë•ùëëx_{d}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the latent variables (hd,zd)subscript‚Ñéùëësubscriptùëßùëë(h_{d},z_{d})( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is given by

p‚Å¢(xd,hd,zd|W,Œ±)=(‚àèvùüô‚àëkzv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d=xv‚Å¢d)‚Å¢p‚Å¢(hd|Œ±)‚Å¢‚àèv,kp‚Å¢(zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d|W,hd),ùëùsubscriptùë•ùëësubscript‚Ñéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëëùëäùõºsubscriptproductùë£subscript1subscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëëùëùconditionalsubscript‚Ñéùëëùõºsubscriptproductùë£ùëòùëùconditionalsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëùëäsubscript‚Ñéùëëp(x_{d},h_{d},z_{d}|W,\alpha)=\Big{(}\prod_{v}\mathbbm{1}_{\sum_{k}z_{vkd}=x_{% vd}}\Big{)}p(h_{d}|\alpha)\prod_{v,k}p(z_{vkd}|W,h_{d}),italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± ) = ( ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ± ) ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where

p‚Å¢(zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d|W,hd)=(wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d)zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Å¢e‚àíwv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dzv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d!ùëùconditionalsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëùëäsubscript‚Ñéùëësuperscriptsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëësuperscriptùëísubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëp(z_{vkd}|W,h_{d})=(w_{vk}h_{kd})^{z_{vkd}}\frac{e^{-w_{vk}h_{kd}}}{z_{vkd}!}italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG

is the probability mass function of the Poisson distribution. Identically to LDA, the introduction of the Dirichlet prior on the topic proportions results in an intractable posterior distribution of the latent variables. We therefore resort to variational inference and approximate the true posterior with a variational distribution qùëûqitalic_q given by

q‚Å¢(h,z|Œ≤,œï)=‚àèdqd‚Å¢(hd,zd|Œ≤d,œïd),qd‚Å¢(hd,zd|Œ≤d,œïd)=q‚Å¢(hd|Œ≤d)‚Å¢‚àèvq‚Å¢(zv‚Å¢d|xv‚Å¢d,œïv‚Å¢d),formulae-sequenceùëû‚ÑéconditionalùëßùõΩitalic-œïsubscriptproductùëësubscriptùëûùëësubscript‚ÑéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëësubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëësubscriptùëûùëësubscript‚ÑéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëësubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëëùëûconditionalsubscript‚ÑéùëësubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptproductùë£ùëûconditionalsubscriptùëßùë£ùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëë\displaystyle q(h,z|\beta,\phi)=\prod_{d}q_{d}(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},\phi_{d})% ,\qquad q_{d}(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},\phi_{d})=q(h_{d}|\beta_{d})\prod_{v}q(z_{% vd}|x_{vd},\phi_{vd}),italic_q ( italic_h , italic_z | italic_Œ≤ , italic_œï ) = ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) = italic_q ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where Œ≤dsubscriptùõΩùëë\beta_{d}italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and œïv‚Å¢dsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëë\phi_{vd}italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are Dirichlet and multinomial parameters, respectively. We will now compute the individual terms of the per-document variational lower bound

log‚Å°p‚Å¢(xd|W,Œ±)ùëùconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëëùëäùõº\displaystyle\log p(x_{d}|W,\alpha)roman_log italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± ) ‚â•ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Å¢(xd,hd,zd|W,Œ±)]‚àíùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°q‚Å¢(hd,zd|Œ≤d,œïd)]absentsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëùsubscriptùë•ùëësubscript‚Ñéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëëùëäùõºsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëûsubscript‚ÑéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëësubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\displaystyle\geq\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log p(x_{d},h_{d},z_{d}|W,\alpha)% \right]-\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log q(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},\phi_{d})\right]‚â• blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± ) ] - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_q ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
=ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Å¢(hd|Œ±)]+ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Å¢(xd,zd|W,hd)]‚àíùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°q‚Å¢(hd)]‚àíùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°q‚Å¢(zd)]absentsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëùconditionalsubscript‚Ñéùëëùõºsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëùsubscriptùë•ùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëëùëäsubscript‚Ñéùëësubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëûsubscript‚Ñéùëësubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëûsubscriptùëßùëë\displaystyle=\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log p(h_{d}|\alpha)\right]+\mathbb{E}_{q}% \!\left[\log p(x_{d},z_{d}|W,h_{d})\right]-\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log q(h_{d})% \right]-\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log q(z_{d})\right]= blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ± ) ] + blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_q ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_q ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
‚âï‚ÑídDP‚Å¢(xd|W,Œ±,Œ≤d,œïd)‚âïabsentsubscriptsuperscript‚ÑíDPùëëconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëëùëäùõºsubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\displaystyle\eqqcolon\mathcal{L}^{\text{DP}}_{d}(x_{d}|W,\alpha,\beta_{d},% \phi_{d})‚âï caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

of the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson model. Plugging in the density of the Dirichlet distribution, the first and third term are given by

ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Å¢(hd|Œ±)]subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëùconditionalsubscript‚Ñéùëëùõº\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log p(h_{d}|\alpha)\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ± ) ] =log‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(‚àëkŒ±k)‚àí‚àëklog‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(Œ±k)+‚àëk(Œ±k‚àí1)‚Å¢ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°hk‚Å¢d],absentŒìsubscriptùëòsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëòŒìsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëòsubscriptùõºùëò1subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle=\log\Gamma(\textstyle\sum_{k}\alpha_{k})-\displaystyle\sum_{k}% \log\Gamma(\alpha_{k})+\sum_{k}(\alpha_{k}-1)\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd}% \right],= roman_log roman_Œì ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ,

for

When combining all terms except data-dependent constants, the summands involving ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d!]subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëë\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log z_{vkd}!\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! ] cancel each other and the per-document variational lower bound simplifies to

‚ÑídDP‚Å¢(xd|W,Œ±,Œ≤d,œïd)subscriptsuperscript‚ÑíDPùëëconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëëùëäùõºsubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\displaystyle\mathcal{L}^{\text{DP}}_{d}(x_{d}|W,\alpha,\beta_{d},\phi_{d})caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =‚àëv,kxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Å¢log‚Å°wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢h~k‚Å¢dœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d+log‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(‚àëkŒ±k)‚àílog‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(‚àëkŒ≤k‚Å¢d)absentsubscriptùë£ùëòsubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëŒìsubscriptùëòsubscriptùõºùëòŒìsubscriptùëòsubscriptùõΩùëòùëë\displaystyle=\sum_{v,k}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}\log\frac{w_{vk}\widetilde{h}_{kd}}{% \phi_{vkd}}\,+\,\log\Gamma(\textstyle{\sum}_{k}\alpha_{k})-\log\Gamma(% \textstyle{\sum}_{k}\beta_{kd})= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG + roman_log roman_Œì ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log roman_Œì ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
+‚àëk(log‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(Œ≤k‚Å¢d)‚àílog‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(Œ±k)+(Œ±k‚àíŒ≤k‚Å¢d)‚Å¢ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°hk‚Å¢d]).subscriptùëòŒìsubscriptùõΩùëòùëëŒìsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle\phantom{=}+\displaystyle\sum_{k}\Big{(}\log\Gamma(\beta_{kd})-% \log\Gamma(\alpha_{k})+(\alpha_{k}-\beta_{kd})\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd% }\right]\Big{)}.+ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_log roman_Œì ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ) .

Finally, the variational lower bound of the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson model is

‚ÑíDP‚Å¢(X|W,Œ±,Œ≤,œï)=‚àëd‚ÑídDP‚Å¢(xd|W,Œ±,Œ≤d,œïd),superscript‚ÑíDPconditionalùëãùëäùõºùõΩitalic-œïsubscriptùëësubscriptsuperscript‚ÑíDPùëëconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëëùëäùõºsubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\mathcal{L}^{\text{DP}}(X|W,\alpha,\beta,\phi)=\sum_{d}\mathcal{L}^{\text{DP}}% _{d}(x_{d}|W,\alpha,\beta_{d},\phi_{d}),caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_Œ≤ , italic_œï ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT DP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

which is identical to the variational lower bound (17) of LDA.

Appendix D Equivalent generative models

The connections between NMF and PLSA or LDA exist because of the close relationships of their underlying generative models, which we summarize in this section.

We say that a parameter of a model is trivial if the marginal distribution of the observed variables XùëãXitalic_X has a unique global optimum with respect to this parameter that can be immediately estimated from the observations XùëãXitalic_X. A model parameter that is not trivial is called non-trivial.

We call two models m1subscriptùëö1m_{1}italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and m2subscriptùëö2m_{2}italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT equivalent if they have the same non-trivial model parameters Œ∏ùúÉ\thetaitalic_Œ∏ and the marginal distributions of the observed variables XùëãXitalic_X are identical up to multiplicative and additive constants after estimating the trivial parameters, i.e.,

pŒ∏m1‚Å¢(X)=c1‚Å¢pŒ∏m2‚Å¢(X)+c2subscriptsuperscriptùëùsubscriptùëö1ùúÉùëãsubscriptùëê1subscriptsuperscriptùëùsubscriptùëö2ùúÉùëãsubscriptùëê2p^{m_{1}}_{\theta}(X)=c_{1}p^{m_{2}}_{\theta}(X)+c_{2}italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∏ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ) = italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_m start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ∏ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ) + italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

for some data-dependent constants c1‚Å¢(X),c2‚Å¢(X)‚àà‚Ñù.subscriptùëê1ùëãsubscriptùëê2ùëã‚Ñùc_{1}(X),c_{2}(X)\in\mathbb{R}.italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ) , italic_c start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X ) ‚àà blackboard_R . It is important to note that potentially existing latent variables are allowed to differ.

Lemma D.1.

Let the model parameters be W‚àà‚Ñù+V√óKùëäsubscriptsuperscript‚ÑùùëâùêæW\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}italic_W ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and h‚àà‚Ñù+K‚Ñésubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæh\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{+}italic_h ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then the following models are equivalent:

  1. (i)

    Xv‚àºPoisson‚Å°((W‚Å¢h)v)similar-tosubscriptùëãùë£Poissonsubscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£X_{v}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}((Wh)_{v})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Poisson ( ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

  2. (ii)

    zv‚Å¢k‚àºPoisson‚Å°(wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk)similar-tosubscriptùëßùë£ùëòPoissonsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòz_{vk}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}(w_{vk}h_{k})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Poisson ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) independent
    Xv=‚àëkzv‚Å¢ksubscriptùëãùë£subscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòX_{v}=\sum_{k}z_{vk}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Proof.

For both models, it holds

p‚Å¢(X1=x1,‚Ä¶,XV=xV|W,h)=e‚àí‚àëv(W‚Å¢h)v‚Å¢‚àèv1xv!‚Å¢(W‚Å¢h)vxv.ùëùformulae-sequencesubscriptùëã1subscriptùë•1‚Ä¶subscriptùëãùëâconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëâùëä‚Ñésuperscriptùëísubscriptùë£subscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£subscriptproductùë£1subscriptùë•ùë£superscriptsubscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£subscriptùë•ùë£p(X_{1}=x_{1},\ldots,X_{V}=x_{V}|W,h)=e^{-\sum_{v}(Wh)_{v}}\prod_{v}\frac{1}{x% _{v}!}(Wh)_{v}^{x_{v}}.italic_p ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h ) = italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (31)

‚àé

Lemma D.2.

Let the model parameters be W‚àà‚Ñù+V√óKùëäsubscriptsuperscript‚ÑùùëâùêæW\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}italic_W ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, h‚àà‚Ñù+K‚Ñésubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæh\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{+}italic_h ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the total number of observations NùëÅNitalic_N. Then the following models are equivalent:

  1. (i)

    (Xv)v‚àºMultinomial‚Å°(N,pv‚àù(W‚Å¢h)v)similar-tosubscriptsubscriptùëãùë£ùë£MultinomialùëÅproportional-tosubscriptùëùùë£subscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£(X_{v})_{v}\sim\operatorname{Multinomial}(N,p_{v}\propto(Wh)_{v})( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Multinomial ( italic_N , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àù ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

  2. (ii)

    (zv‚Å¢k)v‚Å¢k‚àºMultinomial‚Å°(N,pv‚Å¢k‚àùwv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk)similar-tosubscriptsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùë£ùëòMultinomialùëÅproportional-tosubscriptùëùùë£ùëòsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëò(z_{vk})_{vk}\sim\operatorname{Multinomial}(N,p_{vk}\propto w_{vk}h_{k})( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Multinomial ( italic_N , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àù italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
    Xv=‚àëkzv‚Å¢ksubscriptùëãùë£subscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòX_{v}=\sum_{k}z_{vk}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Additionally, the total number of observations NùëÅNitalic_N is a trivial model parameter. If the columns of WùëäWitalic_W are normalized, i.e., W‚ààŒîV‚àí1KùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, then (i) and (ii) are also equivalent to

  1. (iii)

    ‚àÄn=1,‚Ä¶,Nfor-allùëõ1‚Ä¶ùëÅ\forall n=1,\ldots,N‚àÄ italic_n = 1 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N:

    • ‚Ä¢

      zn‚àºCat‚Å°(h)similar-tosubscriptùëßùëõCat‚Ñéz_{n}\sim\operatorname{Cat}(h)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Cat ( italic_h )

    • ‚Ä¢

      ŒΩn‚àºCat‚Å°(wzn)similar-tosubscriptùúàùëõCatsubscriptùë§subscriptùëßùëõ\nu_{n}\sim\operatorname{Cat}(w_{z_{n}})italic_ŒΩ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Cat ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    Xv=‚àënùüôŒΩn=vsubscriptùëãùë£subscriptùëõsubscript1subscriptùúàùëõùë£X_{v}=\sum_{n}\mathbbm{1}_{\nu_{n}=v}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ŒΩ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Proof.

For all three models, it holds

p‚Å¢(X1=x1,‚Ä¶,XV=xV|W,h,N)=ùüô‚àëvxv=N‚Å¢N!‚àèvxv!‚Å¢‚àèv((W‚Å¢h)v‚àëv‚Ä≤(W‚Å¢h)v‚Ä≤)xv.ùëùformulae-sequencesubscriptùëã1subscriptùë•1‚Ä¶subscriptùëãùëâconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëâùëä‚ÑéùëÅsubscript1subscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëÅùëÅsubscriptproductùë£subscriptùë•ùë£subscriptproductùë£superscriptsubscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£subscriptsuperscriptùë£‚Ä≤subscriptùëä‚Ñésuperscriptùë£‚Ä≤subscriptùë•ùë£p(X_{1}=x_{1},\ldots,X_{V}=x_{V}|W,h,N)=\mathbbm{1}_{\sum_{v}x_{v}=N}\frac{N!}% {\prod_{v}x_{v}!}\prod_{v}\Big{(}\frac{(Wh)_{v}}{\sum_{v^{\prime}}(Wh)_{v^{% \prime}}}\Big{)}^{x_{v}}.italic_p ( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h , italic_N ) = blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_N end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_N ! end_ARG start_ARG ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( divide start_ARG ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT . (32)

Note that to see (32) for (ii), the trick is to apply the multinomial theorem

‚àëz‚àà‚Ñï0K‚àëkzk=xx!‚àèkzk!‚Å¢‚àèkykzk=(‚àëkyk)xsubscriptùëßsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñï0ùêæsubscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùëòùë•ùë•subscriptproductùëòsubscriptùëßùëòsubscriptproductùëòsuperscriptsubscriptùë¶ùëòsubscriptùëßùëòsuperscriptsubscriptùëòsubscriptùë¶ùëòùë•\sum_{\begin{subarray}{c}z\in\mathbb{N}_{0}^{K}\\ \sum_{k}z_{k}=x\end{subarray}}\frac{x!}{\prod_{k}z_{k}!}\prod_{k}y_{k}^{z_{k}}% =\Big{(}\sum_{k}y_{k}\Big{)}^{x}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_z ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG end_POSTSUBSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_x ! end_ARG start_ARG ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_x end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

for all x‚àà‚Ñï0ùë•subscript‚Ñï0x\in\mathbb{N}_{0}italic_x ‚àà blackboard_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and y‚àà‚ÑùKùë¶superscript‚Ñùùêæy\in\mathbb{R}^{K}italic_y ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. ‚àé

Lemma D.3.

Let the model parameters be normalized W‚ààŒîV‚àí1KùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and h‚ààŒîK‚àí1‚ÑésubscriptŒîùêæ1h\in\Delta_{K-1}italic_h ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, or normalized W,hùëä‚ÑéW,hitalic_W , italic_h and the total number of observations NùëÅNitalic_N. Then the following models are equivalent:

  1. (i)

    Xv‚àºPoisson‚Å°((W‚Å¢h)v)similar-tosubscriptùëãùë£Poissonsubscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£X_{v}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}((Wh)_{v})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Poisson ( ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

  2. (ii)

    zv‚Å¢k‚àºPoisson‚Å°(wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk)similar-tosubscriptùëßùë£ùëòPoissonsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòz_{vk}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}(w_{vk}h_{k})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Poisson ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) independent
    Xv=‚àëkzv‚Å¢ksubscriptùëãùë£subscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòX_{v}=\sum_{k}z_{vk}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

  3. (iii)

    (Xv)v‚àºMultinomial‚Å°(N,pv=(W‚Å¢h)v)similar-tosubscriptsubscriptùëãùë£ùë£MultinomialùëÅsubscriptùëùùë£subscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£(X_{v})_{v}\sim\operatorname{Multinomial}(N,p_{v}=(Wh)_{v})( italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Multinomial ( italic_N , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

  4. (iv)

    (zv‚Å¢k)v‚Å¢k‚àºMultinomial‚Å°(N,pv‚Å¢k=wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk)similar-tosubscriptsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùë£ùëòMultinomialùëÅsubscriptùëùùë£ùëòsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëò(z_{vk})_{vk}\sim\operatorname{Multinomial}(N,p_{vk}=w_{vk}h_{k})( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Multinomial ( italic_N , italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
    Xv=‚àëkzv‚Å¢ksubscriptùëãùë£subscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòX_{v}=\sum_{k}z_{vk}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

  5. (v)

    ‚àÄn=1,‚Ä¶,Nfor-allùëõ1‚Ä¶ùëÅ\forall n=1,\ldots,N‚àÄ italic_n = 1 , ‚Ä¶ , italic_N:

    • ‚Ä¢

      zn‚àºCat‚Å°(h)similar-tosubscriptùëßùëõCat‚Ñéz_{n}\sim\operatorname{Cat}(h)italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Cat ( italic_h )

    • ‚Ä¢

      ŒΩn‚àºCat‚Å°(wzn)similar-tosubscriptùúàùëõCatsubscriptùë§subscriptùëßùëõ\nu_{n}\sim\operatorname{Cat}(w_{z_{n}})italic_ŒΩ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Cat ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

    Xv=‚àënùüôŒΩn=vsubscriptùëãùë£subscriptùëõsubscript1subscriptùúàùëõùë£X_{v}=\sum_{n}\mathbbm{1}_{\nu_{n}=v}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ŒΩ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_n end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT

Proof.

With observed XùëãXitalic_X, trivially estimated NùëÅNitalic_N and normalized model parameters, (31) and (32) are identical up to a constant due to ‚àëv(W‚Å¢h)v=1.subscriptùë£subscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£1\sum_{v}(Wh)_{v}=1.‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 . ‚àé

Appendix E Gamma‚ÄìPoisson model

In this section, we extend the connections between NMF with a normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W (18) and NMF with a normalization constraint on both WùëäWitalic_W and HùêªHitalic_H (19) / PLSA presented in Appendix¬†B to their Bayesian counterparts: the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson and the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA models. We first introduce the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson model and derive its variational inference algorithm following [7, 6]. Then, we extend the connection between their generative models from [6, Lemma 1] to an algorithmic equivalence of their VI algorithms.

In the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson model we consider, the topics W‚ààŒîV‚àí1KùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT are normalized model parameters. The topic weights hdsubscript‚Ñéùëëh_{d}italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are not normalized and Gamma priors hk‚Å¢d‚àºŒì‚Å¢(Œ±k,ak)similar-tosubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëŒìsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëéùëòh_{kd}\sim\Gamma(\alpha_{k},a_{k})italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) for additional model parameters Œ±,a‚àà‚Ñù>0Kùõºùëésubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæabsent0\alpha,a\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0}italic_Œ± , italic_a ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are introduced. The generative process of each document dùëëditalic_d then becomes

  1. 1.

    Sample the topic weights hk‚Å¢d‚àºŒì‚Å¢(Œ±k,ak)similar-tosubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëŒìsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëéùëòh_{kd}\sim\Gamma(\alpha_{k},a_{k})italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  2. 2.

    Sample the topic contributions zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚àºPoisson‚Å°(wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d)similar-tosubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëPoissonsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëëz_{vkd}\sim\operatorname{Poisson}(w_{vk}h_{kd})italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Poisson ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  3. 3.

    Xv‚Å¢d=‚àëkzv‚Å¢k‚Å¢dsubscriptùëãùë£ùëësubscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëX_{vd}=\sum_{k}z_{vkd}italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT.

Here and in the following, Œì‚Å¢(Œ±k,ak)Œìsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëéùëò\Gamma(\alpha_{k},a_{k})roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) denotes the Gamma distribution with shape parameter Œ±ksubscriptùõºùëò\alpha_{k}italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and rate parameter aksubscriptùëéùëòa_{k}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. The joint likelihood of the observed counts xv‚Å¢dsubscriptùë•ùë£ùëëx_{vd}italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the latent variables (hd,zd)subscript‚Ñéùëësubscriptùëßùëë(h_{d},z_{d})( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is then given by

p‚Å¢(xd,hd,zd|W,Œ±)=(‚àèvùüô‚àëkzv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d=xv‚Å¢d)‚Å¢‚àèkp‚Å¢(hk‚Å¢d|Œ±k,ak)‚Å¢‚àèv,kp‚Å¢(zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d|W,hd),ùëùsubscriptùë•ùëësubscript‚Ñéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëëùëäùõºsubscriptproductùë£subscript1subscriptùëòsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptproductùëòùëùconditionalsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëéùëòsubscriptproductùë£ùëòùëùconditionalsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëùëäsubscript‚Ñéùëëp(x_{d},h_{d},z_{d}|W,\alpha)=\Big{(}\prod_{v}\mathbbm{1}_{\sum_{k}z_{vkd}=x_{% vd}}\Big{)}\prod_{k}p(h_{kd}|\alpha_{k},a_{k})\prod_{v,k}p(z_{vkd}|W,h_{d}),italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± ) = ( ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_1 start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where

p‚Å¢(hk‚Å¢d|Œ±k,ak)ùëùconditionalsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëéùëò\displaystyle p(h_{kd}|\alpha_{k},a_{k})italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =akŒ±kŒì‚Å¢(Œ±k)‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dŒ±k‚àí1‚Å¢e‚àíak‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d,absentsuperscriptsubscriptùëéùëòsubscriptùõºùëòŒìsubscriptùõºùëòsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùõºùëò1superscriptùëísubscriptùëéùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle=\frac{a_{k}^{\alpha_{k}}}{\Gamma(\alpha_{k})}h_{kd}^{\alpha_{k}-% 1}e^{-a_{k}h_{kd}},= divide start_ARG italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_ARG italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,
p‚Å¢(zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d|W,hd)ùëùconditionalsubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëëùëäsubscript‚Ñéùëë\displaystyle p(z_{vkd}|W,h_{d})italic_p ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =(wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d)zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Å¢e‚àíwv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dzv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d!absentsuperscriptsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëësuperscriptùëísubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëë\displaystyle=(w_{vk}h_{kd})^{z_{vkd}}\frac{e^{-w_{vk}h_{kd}}}{z_{vkd}!}= ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! end_ARG

denote the density of the Gamma distribution and probability mass function of the Poisson distribution, respectively. Similar to the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA model, the introduction of the Gamma prior on the topic weights results in an intractable posterior distribution of the latent variables. We apply variational inference and approximate the true posterior with a variational distribution qùëûqitalic_q given by

q‚Å¢(h,z|Œ≤,b,œï)ùëû‚ÑéconditionalùëßùõΩùëèitalic-œï\displaystyle q(h,z|\beta,b,\phi)italic_q ( italic_h , italic_z | italic_Œ≤ , italic_b , italic_œï ) =‚àèdqd‚Å¢(hd,zd|Œ≤d,bd,œïd),absentsubscriptproductùëësubscriptùëûùëësubscript‚ÑéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëësubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptùëèùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\displaystyle=\prod_{d}q_{d}(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},b_{d},\phi_{d}),= ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,
qd‚Å¢(hd,zd|Œ≤d,bd,œïd)subscriptùëûùëësubscript‚ÑéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëësubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptùëèùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\displaystyle q_{d}(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},b_{d},\phi_{d})italic_q start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) =‚àèkq‚Å¢(hk‚Å¢d|Œ≤k‚Å¢d,bk‚Å¢d)‚Å¢‚àèvq‚Å¢(zv‚Å¢d|xv‚Å¢d,œïv‚Å¢d),absentsubscriptproductùëòùëûconditionalsubscript‚ÑéùëòùëësubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùëèùëòùëësubscriptproductùë£ùëûconditionalsubscriptùëßùë£ùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëë\displaystyle=\prod_{k}q(h_{kd}|\beta_{kd},b_{kd})\prod_{v}q(z_{vd}|x_{vd},% \phi_{vd}),= ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ,

where (Œ≤k‚Å¢d,bk‚Å¢d)subscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùëèùëòùëë(\beta_{kd},b_{kd})( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) and œïv‚Å¢dsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëë\phi_{vd}italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT are Gamma and multinomial parameters, respectively. For completeness, we will now compute the individual terms of the per-document variational lower bound

log‚Å°p‚Å¢(xd|W,Œ±,a)ùëùconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëëùëäùõºùëé\displaystyle\log p(x_{d}|W,\alpha,a)roman_log italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_a ) ‚â•ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Å¢(xd,hd,zd|W,Œ±,a)]‚àíùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°q‚Å¢(hd,zd|Œ≤d,bd,œïd)]absentsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëùsubscriptùë•ùëësubscript‚Ñéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëëùëäùõºùëésubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëûsubscript‚ÑéùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëësubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptùëèùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\displaystyle\geq\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log p(x_{d},h_{d},z_{d}|W,\alpha,a)% \right]-\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log q(h_{d},z_{d}|\beta_{d},b_{d},\phi_{d})\right]‚â• blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_a ) ] - blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_q ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ]
