‚âï‚ÑídGaP‚Å¢(xd|W,Œ±,a,Œ≤d,bd,œïd)‚âïabsentsubscriptsuperscript‚ÑíGaPùëëconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëëùëäùõºùëésubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptùëèùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\displaystyle\eqqcolon\mathcal{L}^{\text{GaP}}_{d}(x_{d}|W,\alpha,a,\beta_{d},% b_{d},\phi_{d})‚âï caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_a , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

of the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson model. Plugging in the density of the Gamma distribution, the first and third term are given by

ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Å¢(hd|Œ±,a)]subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëùconditionalsubscript‚Ñéùëëùõºùëé\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log p(h_{d}|\alpha,a)\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_Œ± , italic_a ) ] =‚àëk(Œ±k‚Å¢log‚Å°ak‚àílog‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(Œ±k)+(Œ±k‚àí1)‚Å¢ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°hk‚Å¢d]‚àíak‚Å¢ùîºq‚Å¢[hk‚Å¢d]),absentsubscriptùëòsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëéùëòŒìsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùõºùëò1subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùëéùëòsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle=\sum_{k}\Big{(}\alpha_{k}\log a_{k}-\log\Gamma(\alpha_{k})+(% \alpha_{k}-1)\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd}\right]-a_{k}\mathbb{E}_{q}\!% \left[h_{kd}\right]\Big{)},= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ) ,
ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°q‚Å¢(hd)]subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëûsubscript‚Ñéùëë\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log q(h_{d})\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_q ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] =‚àëk(Œ≤k‚Å¢d‚Å¢log‚Å°bk‚Å¢d‚àílog‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(Œ≤k‚Å¢d)+(Œ≤k‚Å¢d‚àí1)‚Å¢ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°hk‚Å¢d]‚àíbk‚Å¢d‚Å¢ùîºq‚Å¢[hk‚Å¢d])absentsubscriptùëòsubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùëèùëòùëëŒìsubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùõΩùëòùëë1subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùëèùëòùëësubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle=\sum_{k}\Big{(}\beta_{kd}\log b_{kd}-\log\Gamma(\beta_{kd})+(% \beta_{kd}-1)\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd}\right]-b_{kd}\mathbb{E}_{q}\!% \left[h_{kd}\right]\Big{)}= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - roman_log roman_Œì ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - 1 ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] )

for

ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°hk‚Å¢d]subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd}\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] =œà‚Å¢(Œ≤k‚Å¢d)‚àílog‚Å°bk‚Å¢d‚âïlog‚Å°(h~k‚Å¢d),absentùúìsubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùëèùëòùëë‚âïsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle=\psi(\beta_{kd})-\log b_{kd}\eqqcolon\log(\widetilde{h}_{kd}),= italic_œà ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚âï roman_log ( over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) , (33)
ùîºq‚Å¢[hk‚Å¢d]subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[h_{kd}\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] =Œ≤k‚Å¢dbk‚Å¢dabsentsubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùëèùëòùëë\displaystyle=\frac{\beta_{kd}}{b_{kd}}= divide start_ARG italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG

and the digamma function œàùúì\psiitalic_œà, cf.¬†[6, eq.¬†(14)]. Identically to the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson model, the second term reduces to

ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°p‚Å¢(xd,zd|W,hd)]=‚àëv,kœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Å¢xv‚Å¢d‚Å¢log‚Å°(wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢h~k‚Å¢d)‚àí‚àëkùîºq‚Å¢[hk‚Å¢d]‚àí‚àëv,kùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d!],subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëùsubscriptùë•ùëëconditionalsubscriptùëßùëëùëäsubscript‚Ñéùëësubscriptùë£ùëòsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùëòsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùë£ùëòsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëë\displaystyle\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log p(x_{d},z_{d}|W,h_{d})\right]=\sum_{v,% k}\phi_{vkd}x_{vd}\log(w_{vk}\widetilde{h}_{kd})-\sum_{k}\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left% [h_{kd}\right]-\sum_{v,k}\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log z_{vkd}!\right],blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_p ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! ] ,

and the last term is given by

ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°q‚Å¢(zd)]=‚àëvlog‚Å°xv‚Å¢d!‚àí‚àëv,kùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°zv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d!]+‚àëv,kœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Å¢xv‚Å¢d‚Å¢log‚Å°œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d.subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]ùëûsubscriptùëßùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptùë£ùëòsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscriptùëßùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë£ùëòsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëë\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log q(z_{d})\right]=\sum_{v}\log x_{vd}!-\sum_{v,k}% \mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log z_{vkd}!\right]+\sum_{v,k}\phi_{vkd}x_{vd}\log\phi_% {vkd}.blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_q ( italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ] = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_z start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ! ] + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Notice that in contrast to the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson model, the sum ‚àëkùîºq‚Å¢[hk‚Å¢d]subscriptùëòsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\sum_{k}\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[h_{kd}\right]‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] is not a constant because the topic weights are not normalized. When combining all terms except data-dependent constants, the per-document variational lower bound simplifies to

‚ÑídGaPsubscriptsuperscript‚ÑíGaPùëë\displaystyle\mathcal{L}^{\text{GaP}}_{d}caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (xd|W,Œ±,a,Œ≤d,bd,œïd)conditionalsubscriptùë•ùëëùëäùõºùëésubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptùëèùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\displaystyle(x_{d}|W,\alpha,a,\beta_{d},b_{d},\phi_{d})( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_a , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
=‚àëv,kxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚Å¢log‚Å°wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢h~k‚Å¢dœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚àí‚àëkùîºq‚Å¢[hk‚Å¢d]+‚àëk(Œ±k‚Å¢log‚Å°ak‚àíŒ≤k‚Å¢d‚Å¢log‚Å°bk‚Å¢d)absentsubscriptùë£ùëòsubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùëòsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚ÑéùëòùëësubscriptùëòsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùëéùëòsubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùëèùëòùëë\displaystyle=\sum_{v,k}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}\log\frac{w_{vk}\widetilde{h}_{kd}}{% \phi_{vkd}}-\sum_{k}\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[h_{kd}\right]+\sum_{k}\Big{(}\alpha_% {k}\log a_{k}-\beta_{kd}\log b_{kd}\Big{)}= ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )
+‚àëk(log‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(Œ≤k‚Å¢d)‚àílog‚Å°Œì‚Å¢(Œ±k)+(Œ±k‚àíŒ≤k‚Å¢d)‚Å¢ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°hk‚Å¢d]+(bk‚Å¢d‚àíak)‚Å¢ùîºq‚Å¢[hk‚Å¢d]).subscriptùëòŒìsubscriptùõΩùëòùëëŒìsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëësubscriptùëèùëòùëësubscriptùëéùëòsubscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle\phantom{=}+\sum_{k}\Big{(}\log\Gamma(\beta_{kd})-\log\Gamma(% \alpha_{k})+(\alpha_{k}-\beta_{kd})\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd}\right]+(b% _{kd}-a_{k})\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[h_{kd}\right]\Big{)}.+ ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( roman_log roman_Œì ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - roman_log roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) + ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] + ( italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] ) .

Finally, the variational lower bound of the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson model is

‚ÑíGaP‚Å¢(X|W,Œ±,a,Œ≤,b,œï)=‚àëd‚ÑídGaP‚Å¢(xd|W,Œ±,a,Œ≤d,bd,œïd).superscript‚ÑíGaPconditionalùëãùëäùõºùëéùõΩùëèitalic-œïsubscriptùëësubscriptsuperscript‚ÑíGaPùëëconditionalsubscriptùë•ùëëùëäùõºùëésubscriptùõΩùëësubscriptùëèùëësubscriptitalic-œïùëë\mathcal{L}^{\text{GaP}}(X|W,\alpha,a,\beta,b,\phi)=\sum_{d}\mathcal{L}^{\text% {GaP}}_{d}(x_{d}|W,\alpha,a,\beta_{d},b_{d},\phi_{d}).caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_a , italic_Œ≤ , italic_b , italic_œï ) = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT caligraphic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_a , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

We again assume that the prior parameters (Œ±,a)ùõºùëé(\alpha,a)( italic_Œ± , italic_a ) are fixed during model training. Optimizing the variational lower bound with respect to the topics W‚ààŒîV‚àí1KùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and the variational parameters œïv‚Å¢d‚ààŒîK‚àí1subscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëësubscriptŒîùêæ1\phi_{vd}\in\Delta_{K-1}italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT works identically to the derivation of the VI algorithm of the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA model, and their update equations are given by wv‚Å¢k‚àù‚àëdxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢dproportional-tosubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscriptùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëw_{vk}\propto\sum_{d}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àù ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚àùwv‚Å¢k‚Å¢h~k‚Å¢dproportional-tosubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëë\phi_{vkd}\propto w_{vk}\widetilde{h}_{kd}italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àù italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Moreover, setting the derivatives of the variational lower bound with respect to Œ≤k‚Å¢dsubscriptùõΩùëòùëë\beta_{kd}italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and bk‚Å¢dsubscriptùëèùëòùëëb_{kd}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to zero is equivalent to

(œà‚Ä≤‚Å¢(Œ≤k‚Å¢d)‚àí1bk‚Å¢d‚àí1bk‚Å¢dŒ≤k‚Å¢dbk‚Å¢d2)‚Å¢(Œ±k+‚àëvxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d‚àíŒ≤k‚Å¢dak+1‚àíbk‚Å¢d)=(00),matrixsuperscriptùúì‚Ä≤subscriptùõΩùëòùëë1subscriptùëèùëòùëë1subscriptùëèùëòùëësubscriptùõΩùëòùëësuperscriptsubscriptùëèùëòùëë2matrixsubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùëéùëò1subscriptùëèùëòùëëmatrix00\begin{pmatrix}\psi^{\prime}(\beta_{kd})&-\frac{1}{b_{kd}}\\ -\frac{1}{b_{kd}}&\frac{\beta_{kd}}{b_{kd}^{2}}\end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix}% \alpha_{k}+\sum_{v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}-\beta_{kd}\\ a_{k}+1-b_{kd}\end{pmatrix}=\begin{pmatrix}0\\ 0\end{pmatrix},( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_œà start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL start_CELL - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG end_CELL start_CELL divide start_ARG italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG end_CELL end_ROW end_ARG ) ( start_ARG start_ROW start_CELL italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - which yields the update equations Œ≤k‚Å¢d=Œ±k+‚àëvxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢dsubscriptùõΩùëòùëësubscriptùõºùëòsubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëë\beta_{kd}=\alpha_{k}+\sum_{v}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and bk‚Å¢d=1+aksubscriptùëèùëòùëë1subscriptùëéùëòb_{kd}=1+a_{k}italic_b start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 + italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Rewriting the updates involving œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï in the familiar multiplicative form, we obtain Algorithm¬†7. Notice that for fixed prior parameters (Œ±,a)ùõºùëé(\alpha,a)( italic_Œ± , italic_a ) and aside from the trivially estimated variational parameters bùëèbitalic_b, the only difference between Algorithm¬†7 and the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA Algorithm¬†5 is the explicit formula for ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°hk‚Å¢d].subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd}\right].blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] .

Before concretizing the algorithmic equivalence of the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson and Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA VI algorithms, let us recall that the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson model with rate parameters ak=asubscriptùëéùëòùëéa_{k}=aitalic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a extends the generative model of LDA by also modeling the total counts of words in a document.

Lemma E.1 ([6, Lemma 1]).

Let Œ±‚àà‚Ñù>0Kùõºsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæabsent0\alpha\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0}italic_Œ± ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ak=a>0subscriptùëéùëòùëé0a_{k}=a>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a > 0 be fixed prior parameters. Let the model parameter be W‚ààŒîV‚àí1KùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Then the following two models are equivalent:

  1. (i)

    hk‚àºŒì‚Å¢(Œ±k,a)similar-tosubscript‚ÑéùëòŒìsubscriptùõºùëòùëéh_{k}\sim\Gamma(\alpha_{k},a)italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àº roman_Œì ( italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ) independent,
    Xv=Poisson‚Å°((W‚Å¢h)v)subscriptùëãùë£Poissonsubscriptùëä‚Ñéùë£X_{v}=\operatorname{Poisson}((Wh)_{v})italic_X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = roman_Poisson ( ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ).

  2. (ii)

    h‚àºDir‚Å°(Œ±)similar-to‚ÑéDirùõºh\sim\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)italic_h ‚àº roman_Dir ( italic_Œ± ),
    N‚àºPoisson‚àí‚àíGamma‚Å°(‚àëkŒ±k,a)N\sim\operatorname{Poisson--Gamma}(\sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)italic_N ‚àº start_OPFUNCTION roman_Poisson - - roman_Gamma end_OPFUNCTION ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ),
    X‚àºMultinomial‚Å°(N,p=W‚Å¢h)similar-toùëãMultinomialùëÅùëùùëä‚ÑéX\sim\operatorname{Multinomial}(N,p=Wh)italic_X ‚àº roman_Multinomial ( italic_N , italic_p = italic_W italic_h ).

Proof.

For simplicity, we denote the value of the density of the Dirichlet distribution at h‚ààŒîK‚àí1‚ÑésubscriptŒîùêæ1h\in\Delta_{K-1}italic_h ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT by Dir‚Å°(Œ±)‚Å¢(h)Dirùõº‚Ñé\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)(h)roman_Dir ( italic_Œ± ) ( italic_h ), and we use the analogous notation for the probability densities of the Gamma, Poisson, Poisson‚ÄìGamma and multinomial distributions, respectively. We also use the abbreviations PoisPois\operatorname{Pois}roman_Pois and ‚Ñ≥‚Ñ≥\mathcal{M}caligraphic_M to refer to the Poisson and multinomial distributions. With this notation, one can show

p‚Å¢(x|W,Œ±,a)=(‚à´ŒîK‚àí1Dir‚Å°(Œ±)‚Å¢(h)‚Å¢‚Ñ≥‚Å¢(‚àëvxv,p=W‚Å¢h)‚Å¢(x)‚Å¢ùëëh)‚Å¢(‚à´‚Ñù>0Pois‚Å°(Œª)‚Å¢(‚àëvxv)‚Å¢Œì‚Å¢(‚àëkŒ±k,a)‚Å¢(Œª)‚Å¢ùëëŒª)=(‚à´ŒîK‚àí1Dir‚Å°(Œ±)‚Å¢(h)‚Å¢‚Ñ≥‚Å¢(‚àëvxv,p=W‚Å¢h)‚Å¢(x)‚Å¢ùëëh)‚Å¢Poisson‚àí‚àíGamma‚Å°(‚àëkŒ±k,a)‚Å¢(‚àëvxv)=c‚Å¢(x,‚àëkŒ±k,a)‚Å¢(‚à´ŒîK‚àí1Dir‚Å°(Œ±)‚Å¢(h)‚Å¢‚àèvPois‚Å°((W‚Å¢h)v)‚Å¢(xv)‚Å¢d‚Å¢h)\begin{split}&p(x|W,\alpha,a)\\ &=\bigg{(}\int_{\Delta_{K-1}}\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)(h)\mathcal{M}(% \textstyle\sum_{v}x_{v},p=Wh)(x)dh\bigg{)}\bigg{(}\displaystyle\int_{\mathbb{R% }_{>0}}\operatorname{Pois}(\lambda)(\textstyle\sum_{v}x_{v})\Gamma(\textstyle% \sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)(\lambda)d\lambda\bigg{)}\\ &=\bigg{(}\int_{\Delta_{K-1}}\operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)(h)\mathcal{M}(% \textstyle\sum_{v}x_{v},p=Wh)(x)\,dh\bigg{)}\operatorname{Poisson--Gamma}(% \textstyle\sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)(\textstyle\sum_{v}x_{v})\\ &=c(x,\textstyle\sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)\bigg{(}\displaystyle\int_{\Delta_{K-1}}% \operatorname{Dir}(\alpha)(h)\prod_{v}\operatorname{Pois}((Wh)_{v})(x_{v})\,dh% \bigg{)}\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL italic_p ( italic_x | italic_W , italic_Œ± , italic_a ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( ‚à´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Dir ( italic_Œ± ) ( italic_h ) caligraphic_M ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_p = italic_W italic_h ) ( italic_x ) italic_d italic_h ) ( ‚à´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Pois ( italic_Œª ) ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_Œì ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ) ( italic_Œª ) italic_d italic_Œª ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = ( ‚à´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Dir ( italic_Œ± ) ( italic_h ) caligraphic_M ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_p = italic_W italic_h ) ( italic_x ) italic_d italic_h ) start_OPFUNCTION roman_Poisson - - roman_Gamma end_OPFUNCTION ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ) ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL end_CELL start_CELL = italic_c ( italic_x , ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ) ( ‚à´ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Dir ( italic_Œ± ) ( italic_h ) ‚àè start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Pois ( ( italic_W italic_h ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ( italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) italic_d italic_h ) end_CELL end_ROW (34)

for both generative models. The details of the proof are based on the fact that normalized independent Gamma-distributed random variables with identical rate parameter follow a Dirichlet distribution, see [6, Lemma 1]. ‚àé

The Bayesian analogue of Lemma¬†4.2 is the following result.

Corollary E.2.

Let Œ±‚àà‚Ñù>0Kùõºsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæabsent0\alpha\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0}italic_Œ± ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and ak=a>0subscriptùëéùëòùëé0a_{k}=a>0italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a > 0 be fixed prior parameters. Then the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson and Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA likelihoods have the same optima W‚ààŒîV‚àí1K.ùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}.italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Proof.

By (34), the likelihoods are identical up to a constant c‚Å¢(X,‚àëkŒ±k,a)ùëêùëãsubscriptùëòsubscriptùõºùëòùëéc(X,\textstyle\sum_{k}\alpha_{k},a)italic_c ( italic_X , ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a ). ‚àé

Denoting the nùëõnitalic_n-th iterate of the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson Algorithm¬†7 by (W(n),GaP,Œ≤(n),GaP)superscriptùëäùëõGaPsuperscriptùõΩùëõGaP(W^{(n),\text{GaP}},\beta^{(n),\text{GaP}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) and the nùëõnitalic_n-th iterate of Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA Algorithm¬†5 by (W(n),LDA,Œ≤(n),LDA)superscriptùëäùëõLDAsuperscriptùõΩùëõLDA(W^{(n),\text{LDA}},\beta^{(n),\text{LDA}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , LDA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , LDA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ), the Bayesian analogue of Lemma¬†B.1 is the following result.

Lemma E.3.

Let X‚àà‚Ñù+V√óDùëãsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùê∑X\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}italic_X ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and let Œ±‚àà‚Ñù>0K,ak=a>0formulae-sequenceùõºsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæabsent0subscriptùëéùëòùëé0\alpha\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0},\,a_{k}=a>0italic_Œ± ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a > 0 be fixed prior parameters. Let Œªd=‚àëk‚Ä≤Œ±k‚Ä≤+‚àëvxv‚Å¢dsubscriptùúÜùëësubscriptsuperscriptùëò‚Ä≤subscriptùõºsuperscriptùëò‚Ä≤subscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëë\lambda_{d}=\sum_{k^{\prime}}\alpha_{k^{\prime}}+\sum_{v}x_{vd}italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ± start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let W(0)‚ààŒîV‚àí1Ksuperscriptùëä0superscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW^{(0)}\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT and Œ≤(0)‚àà‚Ñù+K√óDsuperscriptùõΩ0superscriptsubscript‚Ñùùêæùê∑\beta^{(0)}\in\mathbb{R}_{+}^{K\times D}italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be arbitrary initial values. Then for all n‚â•1ùëõ1n\geq 1italic_n ‚â• 1

W(n),GaPsuperscriptùëäùëõGaP\displaystyle W^{(n),\text{GaP}}italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =W(n),LDA,absentsuperscriptùëäùëõLDA\displaystyle=W^{(n),\text{LDA}},= italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , LDA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,
Œ≤(n),GaPsuperscriptùõΩùëõGaP\displaystyle\beta^{(n),\text{GaP}}italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =Œ≤(n),LDA=Œ≤(n),absentsuperscriptùõΩùëõLDAsuperscriptùõΩùëõ\displaystyle=\beta^{(n),\text{LDA}}=\beta^{(n)},= italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) , LDA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ,
‚àëkŒ≤k‚Å¢d(n)subscriptùëòsubscriptsuperscriptùõΩùëõùëòùëë\displaystyle\sum_{k}\beta^{(n)}_{kd}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT =Œªd.absentsubscriptùúÜùëë\displaystyle=\lambda_{d}.= italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .
Proof.

The key observation is that the expressions (30) and (33) of ùîºq‚Å¢[log‚Å°hk‚Å¢d]subscriptùîºùëûdelimited-[]subscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\mathbb{E}_{q}\!\left[\log h_{kd}\right]blackboard_E start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT [ roman_log italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ] in the LDA and Gamma‚ÄìPoisson Algorithms¬†7 and¬†5 are identical up to a constant independent of kùëòkitalic_k. More precisely, we have

h~k‚Å¢d(0),GaPsuperscriptsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëë0GaP\displaystyle\widetilde{h}_{kd}^{(0),\text{GaP}}over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) , GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =exp‚Å°(œà‚Å¢(Œ≤k‚Å¢d(0)))1+a,absentùúìsuperscriptsubscriptùõΩùëòùëë01ùëé\displaystyle=\frac{\exp(\psi(\beta_{kd}^{(0)}))}{1+a},= divide start_ARG roman_exp ( italic_œà ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_a end_ARG ,
h~k‚Å¢d(0),LDAsuperscriptsubscript~‚Ñéùëòùëë0LDA\displaystyle\widetilde{h}_{kd}^{(0),\text{LDA}}over~ start_ARG italic_h end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) , LDA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =exp‚Å°(œà‚Å¢(Œ≤k‚Å¢d(0)))exp‚Å°(œà‚Å¢(‚àëk‚Ä≤Œ≤k‚Ä≤‚Å¢d(0))).absentùúìsuperscriptsubscriptùõΩùëòùëë0ùúìsubscriptsuperscriptùëò‚Ä≤superscriptsubscriptùõΩsuperscriptùëò‚Ä≤ùëë0\displaystyle=\frac{\exp(\psi(\beta_{kd}^{(0)}))}{\exp(\psi(\sum_{k^{\prime}}% \beta_{k^{\prime}d}^{(0)}))}.= divide start_ARG roman_exp ( italic_œà ( italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_exp ( italic_œà ( ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚Ä≤ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 0 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) end_ARG .

Consequently, the first iterate of the variational parameters œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢dsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëë\phi_{vkd}italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is identical for the GaP and LDA algorithm, which implies (W(1),GaP,Œ≤(1),GaP)=(W(1),LDA,Œ≤(1),LDA)superscriptùëä1GaPsuperscriptùõΩ1GaPsuperscriptùëä1LDAsuperscriptùõΩ1LDA(W^{(1),\text{GaP}},\beta^{(1),\text{GaP}})=(W^{(1),\text{LDA}},\beta^{(1),% \text{LDA}})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 ) , GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 ) , GaP end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 ) , LDA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 ) , LDA end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ). The induction step and ‚àëkŒ≤k‚Å¢d(n)=ŒªdsubscriptùëòsubscriptsuperscriptùõΩùëõùëòùëësubscriptùúÜùëë\sum_{k}\beta^{(n)}_{kd}=\lambda_{d}‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_Œª start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT follow immediately. ‚àé

Finally, the Bayesian analogue of Corollary¬†B.2 is the following result.

Corollary E.4.

Let X‚àà‚Ñù+V√óDùëãsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùê∑X\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}italic_X ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and let Œ±‚àà‚Ñù>0K,ak=a>0formulae-sequenceùõºsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæabsent0subscriptùëéùëòùëé0\alpha\in\mathbb{R}^{K}_{>0},\,a_{k}=a>0italic_Œ± ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT > 0 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_a > 0 be fixed prior parameters. Let (W‚àó,Œ≤‚àó,b‚àó,œï‚àó)superscriptùëäsuperscriptùõΩsuperscriptùëèsuperscriptitalic-œï(W^{*},\beta^{*},b^{*},\phi^{*})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) be a fixed point the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson VI algorithm. Then bk‚Å¢d‚àó=1+asubscriptsuperscriptùëèùëòùëë1ùëéb^{*}_{kd}=1+aitalic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 + italic_a for all k,dùëòùëëk,ditalic_k , italic_d and (W‚àó,Œ≤‚àó,œï‚àó)superscriptùëäsuperscriptùõΩsuperscriptitalic-œï(W^{*},\beta^{*},\phi^{*})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is a fixed point of the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA VI algorithm. Conversely, let (W‚àó,Œ≤‚àó,œï‚àó)superscriptùëäsuperscriptùõΩsuperscriptitalic-œï(W^{*},\beta^{*},\phi^{*})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) be a fixed point of the Dirichlet‚ÄìPoisson / LDA VI algorithm. Then (W‚àó,Œ≤‚àó,b‚àó,œï‚àó)superscriptùëäsuperscriptùõΩsuperscriptùëèsuperscriptitalic-œï(W^{*},\beta^{*},b^{*},\phi^{*})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_Œ≤ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_œï start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) with bk‚Å¢d‚àó=1+asubscriptsuperscriptùëèùëòùëë1ùëéb^{*}_{kd}=1+aitalic_b start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 + italic_a for all k,dùëòùëëk,ditalic_k , italic_d is a fixed point of the Gamma‚ÄìPoisson VI algorithm.

Proof.

Follows from Lemma¬†E.3 and the update equations of bùëèbitalic_b and œïitalic-œï\phiitalic_œï. ‚àé

Appendix F Sparse NMF

In this section, we first provide details to the derivation of the joint update rules for Lasso-penalized NMF with the KL divergence and ‚Ñì1subscript‚Ñì1\ell_{1}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraints on columns of WùëäWitalic_W. We then prove that Lasso-penalized NMF with the KL divergence and an ‚Ñì1subscript‚Ñì1\ell_{1}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W (24) does not induce any sparsity. Finally, we generalize [34, Lemma 1 and 2] and show that any normalization constraints on the columns of W and penalty terms on H are competing regularizers on the two matrices.

Let us denote the objective function of ‚Ñì1subscript‚Ñì1\ell_{1}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-penalized NMF with the KL divergence and hyperparameter Œª>0ùúÜ0\lambda>0italic_Œª > 0 by

DKLŒª(X||WH)‚âîDKL(X||WH)+Œª‚à•H‚à•1.D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,WH)\coloneqq D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,WH)+\lambda\|% H\|_{1}.italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) ‚âî italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_Œª ‚à• italic_H ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Using Corollary¬†A.3 and W‚ààŒîV‚àí1KùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, a joint auxiliary function of DKLŒªsuperscriptsubscriptùê∑KLùúÜD_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is given by

œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)superscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõ\displaystyle\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT =wv‚Å¢k(n)‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d(n)(W(n)‚Å¢H(n))v‚Å¢d,absentsuperscriptsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòùëõsuperscriptsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëëùëõsubscriptsuperscriptùëäùëõsuperscriptùêªùëõùë£ùëë\displaystyle=\frac{w_{vk}^{(n)}h_{kd}^{(n)}}{(W^{(n)}H^{(n)})_{vd}},= divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG ,
G‚Å¢((W,H),(W(n),H(n)))ùê∫ùëäùêªsuperscriptùëäùëõsuperscriptùêªùëõ\displaystyle G((W,H),(W^{(n)},H^{(n)}))italic_G ( ( italic_W , italic_H ) , ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ) =‚àí‚àëv,k,dxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢œïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)‚Å¢log‚Å°wv‚Å¢k‚Å¢hk‚Å¢dœïv‚Å¢k‚Å¢d(n)+(1+Œª)‚Å¢‚àëk,dhk‚Å¢d.absentsubscriptùë£ùëòùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõsubscriptùë§ùë£ùëòsubscript‚Ñéùëòùëësuperscriptsubscriptitalic-œïùë£ùëòùëëùëõ1ùúÜsubscriptùëòùëësubscript‚Ñéùëòùëë\displaystyle=-\sum_{v,k,d}x_{vd}\phi_{vkd}^{(n)}\log\frac{w_{vk}h_{kd}}{\phi_% {vkd}^{(n)}}+(1+\lambda)\sum_{k,d}h_{kd}.= - ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_k , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_log divide start_ARG italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_œï start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + ( 1 + italic_Œª ) ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT .

Applying the method of Lagrange multipliers, the auxiliary function can be jointly optimized in WùëäWitalic_W and HùêªHitalic_H, and the objective function value is non-increasing under the following joint updates:

wv‚Å¢k(n+1)‚àùwv‚Å¢k(n)‚Å¢‚àëdxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d(n)(W(n)‚Å¢H(n))v‚Å¢d,hk‚Å¢d(n+1)=11+Œª‚Å¢hk‚Å¢d(n)‚Å¢‚àëvxv‚Å¢d‚Å¢wv‚Å¢k(n)(W(n)‚Å¢H(n))v‚Å¢d.formulae-sequenceproportional-tosubscriptsuperscriptùë§ùëõ1ùë£ùëòsubscriptsuperscriptùë§ùëõùë£ùëòsubscriptùëësubscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptsuperscript‚Ñéùëõùëòùëësubscriptsuperscriptùëäùëõsuperscriptùêªùëõùë£ùëësubscriptsuperscript‚Ñéùëõ1ùëòùëë11ùúÜsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñéùëõùëòùëësubscriptùë£subscriptùë•ùë£ùëësubscriptsuperscriptùë§ùëõùë£ùëòsubscriptsuperscriptùëäùëõsuperscriptùêªùëõùë£ùëë\displaystyle w^{(n+1)}_{vk}\propto w^{(n)}_{vk}\sum_{d}x_{vd}\frac{h^{(n)}_{% kd}}{(W^{(n)}H^{(n)})_{vd}},\qquad h^{(n+1)}_{kd}=\frac{1}{1+\lambda}h^{(n)}_{% kd}\sum_{v}x_{vd}\frac{w^{(n)}_{vk}}{(W^{(n)}H^{(n)})_{vd}}.italic_w start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_n + 1 ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚àù italic_w Lemma 6.1.

Let (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of NMF with an ‚Ñì1subscript‚Ñì1\ell_{1}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W (18) and let Œª>0ùúÜ0\lambda>0italic_Œª > 0. Then (W,11+Œª‚Å¢H)ùëä11ùúÜùêª(W,\tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)( italic_W , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Œª end_ARG italic_H ) is a solution of Lasso-penalized NMF with an ‚Ñì1subscript‚Ñì1\ell_{1}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraint (24). Conversely, let (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of (24). Then (W,(1+Œª)‚Å¢H)ùëä1ùúÜùêª(W,(1+\lambda)H)( italic_W , ( 1 + italic_Œª ) italic_H ) is a solution of (18).

Proof.

Notice that for any pair (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) with W‚ààŒîV‚àí1KùëäsuperscriptsubscriptŒîùëâ1ùêæW\in\Delta_{V-1}^{K}italic_W ‚àà roman_Œî start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_V - 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT, we have

DKLŒª(X||W11+ŒªH)=DKL(X||WH)+log(1+Œª)‚àëv,dxv‚Å¢d,DKL(X||W(1+Œª)H)=DKLŒª(X||WH)‚àílog(1+Œª)‚àëv,dxv‚Å¢d.\begin{split}D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W\tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)&=D_{\text{% KL}}(X\,||\,WH)+\log(1+\lambda)\sum_{v,d}x_{vd},\\ D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,W(1+\lambda)H)&=D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,WH)-\log(1% +\lambda)\sum_{v,d}x_{vd}.\end{split}start_ROW start_CELL italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Œª end_ARG italic_H ) end_CELL start_CELL = italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + roman_log ( 1 + italic_Œª ) ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , end_CELL end_ROW start_ROW start_CELL italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W ( 1 + italic_Œª ) italic_H ) end_CELL start_CELL = italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) - roman_log ( 1 + italic_Œª ) ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT . end_CELL end_ROW (35)

The result can now be shown using a proof by contradiction. Let (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) be a solution of (18) and assume that (W,11+Œª‚Å¢H)ùëä11ùúÜùêª(W,\tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)( italic_W , divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Œª end_ARG italic_H ) is not a solution of ‚Ñì1subscript‚Ñì1\ell_{1}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-penalized NMF (24). Then there exists (W‚àó,H‚àó)superscriptùëäsuperscriptùêª(W^{*},H^{*})( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) with DKLŒª(X||W‚àóH‚àó)<DKLŒª(X||W11+ŒªH)D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W^{*}H^{*})<D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W% \tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Œª end_ARG italic_H ). Applying (35), it follows

DKL(X||W‚àó(1+Œª)H‚àó)\displaystyle D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,W^{*}(1+\lambda)H^{*})italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 1 + italic_Œª ) italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) =DKLŒª(X||W‚àóH‚àó)‚àílog(1+Œª)‚àëv,dxv‚Å¢d\displaystyle=D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W^{*}H^{*})-\log(1+\lambda)\sum_{% v,d}x_{vd}= italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) - roman_log ( 1 + italic_Œª ) ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
<DKLŒª(X||W11+ŒªH)‚àílog(1+Œª)‚àëv,dxv‚Å¢d\displaystyle<D_{\text{KL}}^{\lambda}(X\,||\,W\tfrac{1}{1+\lambda}H)-\log(1+% \lambda)\sum_{v,d}x_{vd}< italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Œª end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 1 + italic_Œª end_ARG italic_H ) - roman_log ( 1 + italic_Œª ) ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_v italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT
=DKL(X||WH),\displaystyle=D_{\text{KL}}(X\,||\,WH),= italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT KL end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) ,

which is a contradiction to (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) being a solution of (18). The proof of the second statement is identical. ‚àé

More generally, let us now consider any reconstruction error D(X||WH)D(X||WH)italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) with D:‚Ñù+V√óD√ó‚Ñù+V√óD‚Üí‚Ñù+:ùê∑‚Üísubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùê∑subscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùê∑subscript‚ÑùD:\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}\times\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}\to\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_D : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, any regularizer R‚Å¢(H)ùëÖùêªR(H)italic_R ( italic_H ) with R:‚Ñù+K√óD‚Üí‚Ñù+:ùëÖ‚Üísubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæùê∑subscript‚ÑùR:\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}\to\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_R : blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚Üí blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and any normalization constraint W‚ààùî∏pùëäsubscriptùî∏ùëùW\in\mathbb{A}_{p}italic_W ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, where 0<p<‚àû0ùëù0<p<\infty0 < italic_p < ‚àû and

ùî∏p={W‚àà‚Ñù+V√óK|‚àÄk:‚Äñwk‚Äñp=1}subscriptùî∏ùëùconditional-setùëäsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùêæ:for-allùëòsubscriptnormsubscriptùë§ùëòùëù1\mathbb{A}_{p}=\{W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}\,|\,\forall k:\|w_{k}\|_{p}=1\}blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = { italic_W ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | ‚àÄ italic_k : ‚à• italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = 1 }

denotes the set non-negative matrices with ‚Ñìpsubscript‚Ñìùëù\ell_{p}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-normalized columns. The goal is to solve the following sparse NMF problem

minW‚ààùî∏p,H‚àà‚Ñù+K√óDD(X||WH)+R(H).\min_{W\in\mathbb{A}_{p},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D(X\,||\,WH)+R(H).roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_H ) . (36)

In the special cases of beta divergence reconstruction errors, Lasso- or log-regularizers R‚Å¢(H)=Œª‚Å¢‚ÄñH‚Äñ1ùëÖùêªùúÜsubscriptnormùêª1R(H)=\lambda\|H\|_{1}italic_R ( italic_H ) = italic_Œª ‚à• italic_H ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT or R‚Å¢(H)=Œª‚Å¢‚àëk,dlog‚Å°(hk‚Å¢d)ùëÖùêªùúÜsubscriptùëòùëësubscript‚ÑéùëòùëëR(H)=\lambda\sum_{k,d}\log(h_{kd})italic_R ( italic_H ) = italic_Œª ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k , italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_log ( italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k italic_d end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ), and ‚Ñì1subscript‚Ñì1\ell_{1}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-normalized W‚ààùî∏1ùëäsubscriptùî∏1W\in\mathbb{A}_{1}italic_W ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, it has been shown that (36) is equivalent to an optimization problem without any normalization constraints on WùëäWitalic_W [34, Lemma 1 and 2]. We now generalize this result to (36).

Let us introduce the normalization matrix Dp‚Å¢(W)‚âîdiag‚Å¢(‚Äñw1‚Äñp,‚Ä¶,‚ÄñwK‚Äñp)‚àà‚Ñù+K√óK‚âîsubscriptùê∑ùëùùëädiagsubscriptnormsubscriptùë§1ùëù‚Ä¶subscriptnormsubscriptùë§ùêæùëùsubscriptsuperscript‚ÑùùêæùêæD_{p}(W)\coloneqq\text{diag}(\|w_{1}\|_{p},\ldots,\|w_{K}\|_{p})\in\mathbb{R}^% {K\times K}_{+}italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) ‚âî diag ( ‚à• italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ‚Ä¶ , ‚à• italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_K end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and the optimization problem

minW‚àà‚Ñù+V√óK,H‚àà‚Ñù+K√óDD(X||WH)+R(Dp(W)H).\min_{W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D(X\,||% \,WH)+R(D_{p}(W)H).roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) italic_H ) . (37)

Then the optimization problems (36) and (37) are equivalent in the sense that every solution of (36) is a solution of (37) and normalized solutions of (37) are solutions of (36).

Theorem F.1 (cf.¬†[34, Lemma 1 and 2]).

Let X‚àà‚Ñù+V√óDùëãsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùê∑X\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times D}_{+}italic_X ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Let (W,H)‚ààùî∏p√ó‚Ñù+K√óDùëäùêªsubscriptùî∏ùëùsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæùê∑(W,H)\in\mathbb{A}_{p}\times\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}( italic_W , italic_H ) ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a solution of (36). Then (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) is a solution of (37). Conversely, let (W,H)‚àà‚Ñù+V√óK√ó‚Ñù+K√óDùëäùêªsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùêæsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæùê∑(W,H)\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}\times\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}( italic_W , italic_H ) ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a solution of (37). Then (W‚Å¢Dp‚Å¢(W)‚àí1,Dp‚Å¢(W)‚Å¢H)ùëäsubscriptùê∑ùëùsuperscriptùëä1subscriptùê∑ùëùùëäùêª(WD_{p}(W)^{-1},D_{p}(W)H)( italic_W italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) italic_H ) is a solution of (36).

Proof.

Let (W,H)‚ààùî∏p√ó‚Ñù+K√óDùëäùêªsubscriptùî∏ùëùsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæùê∑(W,H)\in\mathbb{A}_{p}\times\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}( italic_W , italic_H ) ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be a solution of (36). Assume there exists (W‚àó,H‚àó)‚àà‚Ñù+V√óK√ó‚Ñù+K√óDsuperscriptùëäsuperscriptùêªsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùëâùêæsubscriptsuperscript‚Ñùùêæùê∑(W^{*},H^{*})\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+}\times\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT √ó blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT with

D(X||W‚àóH‚àó)+R(Dp(W‚àó)H‚àó)<D(X||WH)+R(Dp(W)H)=D(X||WH)+R(H).D(X\,||\,W^{*}H^{*})+R(D_{p}(W^{*})H^{*})<D(X\,||\,WH)+R(D_{p}(W)H)=D(X\,||\,% WH)+R(H).italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + italic_R ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) < italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W ) italic_H ) = italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_H ) .

Then the normalized matrices (W~,H~)~ùëä~ùêª(\widetilde{W},\widetilde{H})( over~ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG , over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) with W~=W‚àó‚Å¢Dp‚àí1‚Å¢(W‚àó)~ùëäsuperscriptùëäsuperscriptsubscriptùê∑ùëù1superscriptùëä\widetilde{W}=W^{*}D_{p}^{-1}(W^{*})over~ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG = italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) and H~=Dp‚Å¢(W‚àó)‚Å¢H‚àó~ùêªsubscriptùê∑ùëùsuperscriptùëäsuperscriptùêª\widetilde{H}=D_{p}(W^{*})H^{*}over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG = italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_W start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚àó end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT fulfill

D(X||W~H~)+R(H~)<D(X||WH)+R(H),D(X\,||\,\widetilde{W}\widetilde{H})+R(\widetilde{H})<D(X\,||WH)+R(H),italic_D ( italic_X | | over~ start_ARG italic_W end_ARG over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) + italic_R ( over~ start_ARG italic_H end_ARG ) < italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_R ( italic_H ) ,

contradicting that (W,H)ùëäùêª(W,H)( italic_W , italic_H ) is a solution of (36). The proof of the second statement is analogous. ‚àé

Example.

Let 0<p,q<‚àûformulae-sequence0ùëùùëû0<p,q<\infty0 < italic_p , italic_q < ‚àû and consider (36) with W‚ààùî∏pùëäsubscriptùî∏ùëùW\in\mathbb{A}_{p}italic_W ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT and R‚Å¢(H)=Œª‚Å¢‚ÄñH‚ÄñqqùëÖùêªùúÜsuperscriptsubscriptnormùêªùëûùëûR(H)=\lambda\|H\|_{q}^{q}italic_R ( italic_H ) = italic_Œª ‚à• italic_H ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT for some weight Œª>0ùúÜ0\lambda>0italic_Œª > 0. Then

minW‚ààùî∏p,H‚àà‚Ñù+K√óDD(X||WH)+Œª‚à•H‚à•qq\min_{W\in\mathbb{A}_{p},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D(X\,||\,WH)+\lambda% \|H\|_{q}^{q}roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_Œª ‚à• italic_H ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT

is equivalent to

minW‚àà‚Ñù+V√óK,H‚àà‚Ñù+K√óDD(X||WH)+Œª‚àëk‚à•wk‚à•pq‚à•hkT‚à•qq.\min_{W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D(X\,||% \,WH)+\lambda\sum_{k}\|w_{k}\|_{p}^{q}\|h_{k}^{T}\|_{q}^{q}.roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_Œª ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_q end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

This result demonstrates that the normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W and the regularizer R‚Å¢(H)ùëÖùêªR(H)italic_R ( italic_H ) are competing penalties.

Example ([34]).

Let p=1ùëù1p=1italic_p = 1 and consider (36) with the beta divergence D=DŒ≤ùê∑subscriptùê∑ùõΩD=D_{\beta}italic_D = italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ≤ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for Œ≤‚àà‚ÑùùõΩ‚Ñù\beta\in\mathbb{R}italic_Œ≤ ‚àà blackboard_R, W‚ààùî∏1ùëäsubscriptùî∏1W\in\mathbb{A}_{1}italic_W ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and R‚Å¢(H)=Œª‚Å¢‚ÄñH‚Äñ1ùëÖùêªùúÜsubscriptnormùêª1R(H)=\lambda\|H\|_{1}italic_R ( italic_H ) = italic_Œª ‚à• italic_H ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT for some weight Œª>0ùúÜ0\lambda>0italic_Œª > 0. Then

minW‚ààùî∏1,H‚àà‚Ñù+K√óDDŒ≤(X||WH)+Œª‚à•H‚à•1\min_{W\in\mathbb{A}_{1},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D_{\beta}(X\,||\,WH)% +\lambda\|H\|_{1}roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ‚àà blackboard_A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ≤ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_Œª ‚à• italic_H ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT (38)

is equivalent to

minW‚àà‚Ñù+V√óK,H‚àà‚Ñù+K√óDDŒ≤(X||WH)+Œª‚àëk‚à•wk‚à•1‚à•hkT‚à•1,\min_{W\in\mathbb{R}^{V\times K}_{+},\,H\in\mathbb{R}^{K\times D}_{+}}D_{\beta% }(X\,||\,WH)+\lambda\sum_{k}\|w_{k}\|_{1}\|h_{k}^{T}\|_{1},roman_min start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_W ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V √ó italic_K end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_H ‚àà blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_K √ó italic_D end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_D start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_Œ≤ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_X | | italic_W italic_H ) + italic_Œª ‚àë start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• italic_w start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ‚à• italic_h start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_k end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ‚à• start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

suggesting that a Lasso penalty on HùêªHitalic_H together with an ‚Ñì1subscript‚Ñì1\ell_{1}roman_‚Ñì start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT normalization constraint on WùëäWitalic_W induces mutual sparsity [34]. However, Lemma¬†6.1 proves that there is no effect on the sparsity in the case Œ≤=1ùõΩ1\beta=1italic_Œ≤ = 1, demonstrating that the effect on the sparsity also depends on the reconstruction error.
